title: Jordan's Stormy Banks
verses: On Jordan's stormy banks I stand, And
There gen'rous fruits that never fail, On
cast a wishful eye. To Canaan's fair and happy land,
trees im-mor-tal grow; There rocks and hills and brooks and vale,
Where my possessions lie. O, the transporting,
With milk and honey flow. All o'er those wide ex-

metadata.musical_notation: Present with treble and bass clef
metadata.theological_significance: Classic hymn about crossing Jordan River to reach the promised land of Canaan
